B4-25 aptamer

Mar 4, 2024 • Zhizhong Lu

横向排列的点击按钮


Description

 In 1990, Andrew D. Ellington & Jack W. Szostak isolated RNA binding to some dyes through in vitro selection experiments, and named these RNA specifically binding as aptamers[1].


SELEX

Detailed information are accessible on SELEX page.

Structure

The sequence and secondary prediction structure of the aptamer will be shown here[1].

5’-GGGAGAAUUCCCGCGGCGUUGGCCCAGGAUAAUAGGACGAAAUCCGAAAAAUCCGUACCCAACAUAGAACCCCCCCAGCGCUCACACGGACGCCCCAUUACGGCUAACCGAACGCCUGCAGCCGGAAGCUU-3'


Ligand information

SELEX ligand

Reactive Blue 4 is an organic dye used in textiles. Reactive Blue 4 is water-soluble and a pollutant, and has been decolourized in water using microbial fuel cells,Dyes and metabolites.----from ChemBook

Name Affinity Molecular Formula MW CAS Solubility
Reactive Blue 4 ~600uM C23H14Cl2N6O8S2 637.4 g/mol 13324-20-4 80g/L (at 20 °C)
